fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \eta and \epsilon be the unit and counits of the adjunction F\dashv G. We give a unit \eta ' and counit \epsilon ' witnessing the adjunction F_*\dashv G_*. Given a functor J\xrightarrow {H} C, the component H\xrightarrow {\eta '_H} GFH is the whiskered natural transformation \eta H. Given a functor J\xrightarrow {K} D, the component FGK\xrightarrow {\epsilon '_K} K is similarly \epsilon K.

Let \eta and \epsilon be the unit and counits of the adjunction F\dashv G. We give a unit \eta ' and counit \epsilon ' witnessing the adjunction F_*\dashv G_*. Given a functor J\xrightarrow {H} C, the component H\xrightarrow {\eta '_H} GFH is the whiskered natural transformation \eta H. Given a functor J\xrightarrow {K} D, the component FGK\xrightarrow {\epsilon '_K} K is similarly \epsilon K.
